timeline.bodyText: Not a change of yours, but I think we can declare this as final
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: good catch, both node and nodeContainerFactory are final, they cannot be modified by specializations
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.author: afalhambra
afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: just to double check whether we don't want to expose this outside of this package? default access modifier is ok or should we use public?
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText:
In this case "default" scope is intentional,  although open to debate
As pro we prevent this class to be referenced outside this package (which is why is "default" is used, we do not want that under any circunstance)
As cons we prevent any other specialization outside this package, which is probably fine, to force all potential specializations to live in the same package.
So Ill kept this for now.
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: Not a change of yours, but we can change it now as it may be final
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Actually this private field nodeContainer should be removed and use parent one
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.bodyText: I like pepe - I use the same literal string in my tests :D
timeline.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: Maybe testProcessBuilderFactory is more appropriated here to avoid any confusion, wdyt?

replies.bodyText: Changed to testProcessBuilder (to align with class name)
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.bodyText: I would add an assert here making sure that the ProcessInstance object created is not null, just to make test more robust, wdyt?
